japanese: ほら、このコースだったら行けると思うんだよね。
translation: I think we can take this route.

japanese: やっぱり無理……。
translation: Oh, never mind, it's impossible...

japanese:
やってみようよー。
絶対に楽しいって！
translation:
Let's give it a try!
It'll definitely be fun!

japanese: こんなところで、なにを立ち話してるんだ？
translation: What are you standing here chatting about?

japanese:
フータロー？
もしかして、私に会いに来てくれたの？
translation: Futaro? Did you perhaps come to see me?

japanese:
いや……偶然というか……
たまたま通りかかっただけだ。
translation:
No... It's just a coincidence or whatever...
I just happened to pass by here.

japanese: そっか。
translation: I see.

japanese:
上杉さーん、そんな言い方はダメですよ。
たとえ偶然だとしても三玖に会えたんです。
ここは喜ぶところですよ？
translation:
Uesugi-saaan, you shouldn't say that.
Even if it's a coincidence,
you got to see Miku. You should be happy about that.

japanese: お前もいるじゃないか。
translation: You're here too, aren't you.

japanese:
私のことは気にしないでいいですから。
では、そういうことで！
translation:
Don't worry about me.
Well then, see you later!

japanese: おい、ちょっと待て。
translation: Hey, wait a second.

japanese: なんですか？
translation: What is it?

japanese:
たとえ偶然だとしても、出会ったら一緒に過ごす。
そう決めたのはお前らだろ？
translation:
Even if we met by chance,
we decided to spend time together.
Weren't you the ones who decided that?

japanese: それは、そうなんですけど……。
translation: Well, I suppose...

japanese: つか、三玖は裏通りに行くって言ってたよな？
translation:
And besides, Miku,
you said you were going to the backstreets, right?

japanese:
ここも裏通りの１つだよ。
それで、たまたま四葉と会ったから。
translation:
This is one of those backstreets.
I just happened to meet Yotsuba here.

japanese:
そういうことか。
で、なんの話してんだ？
translation: I see. So, what were you talking about?

japanese:
レンタサイクルがあるから、自転車を借りて
観光地を巡るのもいいかなって話。
translation:
We were talking about renting bicycles
and touring the sightseeing spots.

japanese:
ああ、観光地だとそういうサービスがよくあるよな。
面白そうじゃないか。
translation:
Ah, I see.
That kind of service is common in tourist areas.
It sounds interesting.

japanese: でも、私は止めておいたほうがいいと思って。
translation: But I think it's better if I don't do it.

japanese: どうしてだ？
translation: Why?

japanese:
だって、私たちじゃ
四葉のスピードについて行けるわけないし。
translation:
Because there's no way I can keep up
with Yotsuba's speed.

japanese:
……確かに。
特に俺と三玖にとっては致命的な問題だな。
translation:
...That's true.
It would be a complete disaster for Miku and I.

japanese:
ええ～、上杉さんまで。
ちゃんとみんなに合わせますって。
translation:
Whaa, even you, Uesugi-san?
I'll make sure to match everyone else's pace.

japanese:
いや、お前はテンションが上がると
周りが見えなくなるからな。
景色に見とれて爆走し始めたりしそうだ。
translation:
No, your enthusiasm makes you lose sight
of your surroundings. You might get distracted
by the scenery and start speeding up.

japanese: 目に浮かぶ……。
translation: Your eyes do wander...

japanese:
ううっ！
否定できないのが悔しいです。
translation:
Oooohh!
It's frustrating that I can't deny it.

japanese:
とはいえ、サイクリングって案は
悪くないんじゃないか？
translation:
However, cycling doesn't sound like a bad idea,
does it?

japanese:
あくまでゆっくりしたスピードで、
海岸沿いなんて走ったら気持ちいいだろうし。
translation:
At a leisurely pace,
it would feel great to ride along the coast.

japanese: でも、五月が。
translation: But, Itsuki.

japanese:
あー！　そうだった！
うっかり忘れてた！
translation:
Ah! That's right!
I completely forgot!

japanese: なんだ、五月がどうかしたのか？
translation: What's up with Itsuki?

japanese: ……言ってもいいのかな？
translation: ...Is it okay to say it?

japanese:
実はですね、私たちの中で
五月だけ自転車に乗れないんです。
translation:
The thing is, Itsuki's the only one
among us that can't ride a bike.

japanese: もう言ってるし……。
translation: You just went and said it...

japanese:
ほほう、それは知らなかった。
五月がねぇ。
translation:
Oh wow, I didn't know that.
That's so Itsuki, huh?

japanese:
あっ！　上杉さん？
自転車に乗れないからって、
五月を茶化したりしちゃダメですからね？
translation:
Ah! Uesugi-san?
You shouldn't make fun of Itsuki
just because she can't ride a bike, you know?

japanese: わかってるって。
translation: I know.

japanese: ……本当にわかってる？
translation: ...Do you really know, though?

japanese: しかし、そんなこと今日まで知らなかったな。
translation: However, I didn't know that until today.

japanese: 五月本人は周りに隠してるから。
translation: Itsuki's been hiding it from those around her.

japanese:
けど私たちにはバレバレなんだよね。
あはは……。
translation: Though it's obvious to us. Ahaha...

japanese:
うーん。
でも乗れたほうが絶対に便利だと思うし――
translation:
Hmmm.
But I think it would be much more convenient
if she could ride%p-2;――

japanese:
そろそろ知らない振りは止めて、
自転車特訓をしたほうがいいかな？
translation:
Maybe we should stop pretending that
we don't know, and start special bicycle 
training for her?

japanese:
ほら、みんなでサイクリングに行く計画を立てて、
それを目標にすれば、五月も頑張れるかも！
translation:
Yeah, we can make plans to go cycling together
and make it a goal for Itsuki to work towards!

japanese:
いいんじゃないか？
頑張れよ。
translation:
That'd be nice, huh?
Good luck with that.

japanese:
上杉さん？
どうして他人事みたいに言ってるんですか？
translation:
Uesugi-san?
Why are you talking about it
like you're not involved?

japanese: えっ？
translation: Huh?

japanese: フータローも一緒にサイクリングに行こう。
translation: Let's go cycling together, Futaro.

japanese: それは構わないが……。
translation: That's fine, but...

japanese:
で、五月が乗れるようにならないと、
サイクリングに行けないわけです。
translation: Well, we can't go cycling until Itsuki can ride.

japanese: 当然、上杉さんも協力してくれますよね？
translation: Of course, you'll help us, right, Uesugi-san?

japanese:
お前は五月に、
どうしても乗れるようになってほしいのか？
translation:
Why do you want Itsuki
to be able to ride so badly?

japanese:
だって、なんだか寂しいじゃないですか。
１人だけ乗れないのは。
translation:
Well, it's kind of lonely, you know.
If only one person can't ride.

japanese:
計画を立てるのは勝手だが、
無理にやらせなくてもいいんじゃないか？
translation:
It's fine to make a plan as you like,
but it'd be best not to force her, right?

japanese:
やるにしても、せめて五月の意思を
確認してからにしておけよ。
translation:
If you're going to do it,
at least confirm with Itsuki first.

japanese:
もちろんです。
無理強いするつもりはありませんから。
translation:
Of course.
I have no intention of forcing anyone.

japanese:
まあ、お前らの頼みなら、
あいつも頑張ってくれるかもな。
translation:
Well, if you request it,
she just might give it her all.

japanese:
練習用の自転車とかあるのかな？
あとで調べてみよう。
translation:
I wonder if there are practice bikes or something.
I'll look it up later.

japanese:
お前は五月に、
どうしても乗れるようになってほしいのか？
translation:
Why do you want Itsuki
to be able to ride so badly?

japanese:
だって、なんだか寂しいじゃないですか。
１人だけ乗れないのは。
translation:
Well, it's kind of lonely, you know.
If only one person can't ride.

japanese: 目標を立てるのはいい案だな。
translation: Setting goals is a good idea.

japanese:
ホントですか？
おお、まさか上杉さんに褒められるとは！
translation:
Really?
Oh, I never thought I'd be praised by you,
Uesugi-san!

japanese:
お前らだって、
目標があったから勉強を頑張れただろ？
それと同じだ。
translation:
You guys studied hard because you had goals,
didn't you?
It's the same thing.

japanese: あ、確かにその通りです。
translation: Oh, that's true.

japanese: 嫌いな勉強も、目標があるから頑張れた。
translation:
I was able to work hard,
even on subjects I didn't like,
because I had goals.

japanese:
ゴール地点が見えてるのは大事なことだ。
自分がどれだけ進んだのかもわかりやすいしな。
translation:
It's important to be able to see the finish line.
It's easy to see how far you've come.

japanese:
よーし！
旅行から戻ったら五月に提案してみます。
translation:
Alright!
I'll suggest it to Itsuki
when we get back from our trip.

japanese:
練習用の自転車とかあるのかな？
あとで調べてみよう。
translation:
I wonder if there are practice bikes or something.
I'll look it up later.

japanese:
お前は五月に、
どうしても乗れるようになってほしいのか？
translation:
Why do you want Itsuki
to be able to ride so badly?

japanese:
だって、なんだか寂しいじゃないですか。
１人だけ乗れないのは。
translation:
Well, it's kind of lonely, you know.
If only one person can't ride.

japanese:
大丈夫ですよ。
五月には、私たちや上杉さんがついてるんです。
できないことはありません！
translation:
I'm sure it'll be fine. Itsuki will have us
and Uesugi-san to support her.
There's nothing she can't do!

japanese:
なにせ、このお馬鹿な私が
みんなのおかげで大学に入れちゃった
くらいですから。
translation:
After all, thanks to everyone, even silly ol' me
was able to get into university.

japanese:
私も、四葉や二乃が協力してくれたから
料理ができるようになった。
translation:
I also learned how to cook,
thanks to the help of Yotsuba and Nino.

japanese: きっと五月も自転車に乗れるようになるよ。
translation: I'm sure Itsuki will be able to ride a bicycle too.

japanese:
それで、五月が乗れるようになったら
みんなでサイクリングだ！
translation:
So, when Itsuki learns to ride a bike,
let's all go cycling together!

japanese:
じゃあ、五月が乗れるようになったら
みんなでサイクリングに行こうね！
translation:
Okay, so when Itsuki learns to ride a bike,
let's all go cycling together!

japanese:
みんなでもいいけど……
私はフータローと２人でも行ってみたい。
translation:
That's a good idea to go with everyone, but...
I'd like to go with Futaro. Just the two of us.

japanese: 私たち２人なら、同じペースで走れそうだよね。
translation:
If it's just the two of us,
we could ride at the same pace, right?

japanese:
いや……。
俺とお前だけじゃ少し不安じゃないか？
主に体力とか。
translation:
Well... I'd be a little worried
if it's just you and me.
Mostly about our physical endurance.

japanese:
じゃあ、上杉さんと三玖も一緒に特訓しましょうか！
にしし！
translation:
Then, shall I train with both of you?!
Tee-hee!
